title: RNA sequencing library construction for Illumina GA II
original description: This protocol is from:  Jian Cao, et. al. (2014) Insight into Insulin Secretion from Transcriptome and Genetic Analysis of Insulin-Producing Cells of Drosophila Genetics 197:175-192; doi:10.1534/genetics.113.160663  Please see the full manuscript for additional details.
steps:
None
1. Fragment 400ng of amplified mRNA to 10‐200nt using 10x RNA fragmentation buffer (Ambion)
2. Purify using regular ethanol precipitation method with 0.35μl of GlycoBlue (Ambion).
3. Dephosphorylate the 3’ end the RNA samples using 10x Antarctic Phosphatase Buffer and 0.5 μl Antarctic Phosphatase (NEB) at 37 °C for 20 minutes. 
1200s
4. Heat inactivate at 75°C for 10 minutes. 
600s
5. Phosphorylate the 5’ end of RNA samples was  using 10x T4 DNA ligase buffer (it has 1mM ATP final) and T4 PNK (NEB) at 37 °C for 30 minutes. 
1800s
6. Purify the RNAs in the reactions using ammonium acetate and ethanol precipitation with 2μl of GlycoBlue (Ambion).
7. Ligate the RNA samples at 37 °C for one hour to 3’ linker (5’‐/5rApp/CTG TAG GCA CCA TCA AT/3ddC/‐3’) (synthesized by IDT) using:
 T4 RNA ligase 1 (NEB), 
5X ATP‐free T4 RNA ligase buffer (16.5 mM DTT, 41.5% glycerol, 250 mM HEPES‐KOH, pH8.3, 50 mM MgCl2, 50 μg/ml acetylated BSA), 
and 10% DMSO . 
3600s
8. Purify the RNAs in the reactions using ammonium acetate and ethanol precipitation with 2μl of GlycoBlue (Ambion).
9. Run the RNA samples on 6% TBE‐Urea PAGE Gel (Invitrogen).
10. Cut 100‐200nt bands and elute overnight with 400μl stop solution (1M ammonium acetate and 10mM EDTA) at 4°C. 
64800s
11. Purify the RNAs in the supernatant using regular ethanol precipitation method with 2μl of GlycoBlue (Ambion).
12. Ligate the RNA samples at 37°C for 1 hour to 5’ linker (with bar code) using:
 T4 RNA ligase 1 (NEB), 
10x T4 RNA ligase 1 buffer (NEB), 
and 10% DMSO . 
3600s
13. Purify the RNAs by ammonium acetate and ethanol precipitation and gel purification as described in steps 8-11.  
NOTES The 5’ barcoded linkers are synthesized by IDT.    IPC1: 5’‐/5AmMC6/ ACG CTC TTC CGA TCT rCrUrGrG‐3’ IPC2: 5’‐/5AmMC6/ ACG CTC TTC CGA TCT rCrGrUrC‐3’  Control 1: 5’‐/5AmMC6/ ACG CTC TTC CGA TCT rArCrUrU‐3’  Control 2: 5’‐/5AmMC6/ ACG CTC TTC CGA TCT rCrCrCrU‐3’
14. Reverse transcribe cDNA of the RNA samples using SuperScript III (Invitrogen) following manufacture’s protocol.  The primer sequence used for reverse transcription is 5’‐ATT GAT GGT GCC TAC AG‐3’.
15. Amplify the cDNA samples using Taq (NEB) following manufacture’s protocol.  
NOTES Forward primer: 5’‐GAT ACG GCG ACC ACC GAG ATC TAC ACT CTT TCC CTA CAC GAC GCT CTT CCG ATC T‐3’.   Reverse primer: 5’‐CAA GCA GAA GAC GGC ATA CGA GCT CTT CCG ATC TAT TGA TGG TGC CTA CAG‐3’.
16. Purify the PCR products (200‐300nt) using Qiagen PCR purification kit.
17. Dilute the purified PCR samples to 10nM and sequence using Illumina GA II sequencing system.
